main event: A sighting of an unidentified aerial object was reported in Bloomington, Wisconsin on 19 August 1949 by Mr. and Mrs. [redacted].
interesting points: The object was described as exceedingly shiny, resembling a mirror with wing-like appendages.
It was estimated to be traveling at a speed of 200-300 miles per hour at an altitude of approximately 450 feet.
The witness stated that the object appeared stable and that no propulsion or noise was visible or heard.
Another individual reported hearing a loud passing noise from the sky at a different date, which did not resemble the noise of a plane or group of planes.
A letter to Congressman Gardner R. Withrow described a 'very queer object' seen resembling a bright balloon, which disappeared out of sight.
